unnormalised: The Ministry of Education has announced updates to the PM Poshan Shakti Nirman scheme, allocating ₹12,000 Cr for the fiscal year 2024-25. This revised budget aims to enhance nutritional support for children in govt. and govt.-aided schools across India. The initiative targets approx. 11.8 Cr students, ensuring they receive at least 1 meal a day.
normalised: The Ministry of Education has announced updates to the P-M Poshan Shakti Nirman scheme, allocating rupee twelve billion for the fiscal year two thousand and twenty four to two thousand and twenty five. This revised budget aims to enhance nutritional support for children in government and government aided schools across India. The initiative targets approximately one hundred and eighteen million students, ensuring they receive at least one meal a day.

unnormalised: Under the scheme, states like UP and Bihar will receive the largest share of funds, given their high student populations. Furthermore, the ministry plans to integrate millets and locally sourced grains into the school meal programs, aligning with the National Education Policy 2020’s emphasis on promoting holistic well-being. Guidelines stipulate that minimum nutritional requirements should be 450 calories and 12 grams of protein per primary student.
normalised: Under the scheme, states like U-P and Bihar will receive the largest share of funds, given their high student populations. Furthermore, the ministry plans to integrate millets and locally sourced grains into the school meal programs, aligning with the National Education Policy two thousand and twenty's emphasis on promoting holistic well being. Guidelines stipulate that minimum nutritional requirements should be four hundred and fifty calories and twelve grams of protein per primary student.

unnormalised: The PM e-Vidya program, another key component of the government's educational initiatives, has also seen an expansion. Over 200 educational TV channels are now broadcasting content for classes 1 to 12. Officials at NCERT are developing additional resources available on DIKSHA portal to supplement classroom teaching. The goal is to ensure equitable access to quality education for all, particularly in rural areas where internet connectivity remains a challenge.
normalised: The P-M e-Vidya program, another key component of the government's educational initiatives, has also seen an expansion. Over two hundred educational T-V channels are now broadcasting content for classes one to twelve. Officials at N-C-E-R-T are developing additional resources available on D-I-K-S-H-A portal to supplement classroom teaching. The goal is to ensure equitable access to quality education for all, particularly in rural areas where internet connectivity remains a challenge.
